definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Sometimes, I'm a fish on the band .
sentences.chinese: 有时候，我也是一条岸上的小鱼儿。

sentences.english: Not only can walking fish live out of water but they can also travel short distances over land.
sentences.chinese: 鲇鱼不仅可以离开水存活，还可以在岸上短间隔移动。

sentences.english: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
sentences.chinese: 到了晚上，船在海中，耶稣独自在岸上。

sentences.english: Transfer waste to an approved waste reception facility ashore.
sentences.chinese: 将废物转移到认可的岸上废物接收装置。

sentences.english: Arrived on the bank, see have a lot of fine sand, use hop-pocket.
sentences.chinese: 到了岸上，看见有许多细沙，便用布袋。

sentences.english: The lifeguard helps Dan out of the water.
sentences.chinese: 救生员帮助丹恩回到岸上。

sentences.english: Tang sugar on the shore looking at all the time, also dont know exactly who to help.
sentences.chinese: 唐糖一直在岸上看着，也不知道到底该帮谁。

sentences.english: He started up the shore with the mast furled sail of his boat.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着桅竿和卷起的船帆，往岸上爬去。

sentences.english: Sometimes he climbed to the banks of the River Styx to look at the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 有时，他爬到冥河岸上，观看大地。

sentences.english: Don't look too much at the compass. Get a good mark on shore.
sentences.chinese: 不要总看罗经，要找出岸上显著物标。

sentences.english: I want to prebook a shore excursion for one.
sentences.chinese: 我想预订参加一个岸上观光团。

sentences.english: Not only can walking fish live out of water，but they can also travel short distances over land.
sentences.chinese: 鲇鱼不仅可以离开水存活，还可以在岸上短距离移动。

sentences.english: This second trip fairly aroused the watchers along shore.
sentences.chinese: 小划子的第二趟行程可大大惊动了岸上的守望者。

sentences.english: Forceyour opponent to come on land with his Stingrays whenever possible.
sentences.chinese: 在可能的时候逼迫你的敌人把黄貂鱼赶到岸上来。

sentences.english: Many people have been seeing these two Narwhals every single day.
sentences.chinese: 有一头被冲到岸上的死鲸，它是两头独角鲸的妈妈。

definition: opposite bank (of a body of water)
the bow or prow of a ship
sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
Shuili township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
